intro: Saussurea mollis, commonly known as goldenroot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the European Alps. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, yellowish to golden flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Its roots are thick and fleshy, often harvested for their medicinal properties. Saussurea mollis is well adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
